pullRequest.title: Update concurrent feature to use transformer
pullRequest.bodyText:
Stop implementing both the javax and jakarta interfaces
Use transformer to convert from javax to jakarta
Update feature files to use the new jakarta-ified bundle for concurrent-2.0 and remove reference to jakarta API bundle from concurrent-1.0
Switch to publish concurrent-2.0 API bundle to dev/ instead of lib/ directory
Fixed bug where concurrent-1.0 was not marked singleton which allowed both concurrent-1.0 and concurrent-2.0 to both start causing all kinds of havoc.

Relatively this change puts things back to where they were to not have to do instance of javax and jakarta classes and not having to implement both interfaces and just does the transformer which didn't exist at the time that concurrent was updated as a proof of concept on getting jakarta stuff working.

nodes.bodyText: FYI, I asked @aguibert to rename this feature to io.openliberty.concurrent-2.0
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,11 +15,10 @@ Subsystem-Name: Jakarta EE Concurrency 2.0
   com.ibm.websphere.appserver.containerServices-1.0, \
   com.ibm.websphere.appserver.contextService-1.0, \
   com.ibm.websphere.appserver.eeCompatible-9.0, \
-  io.openliberty.jakarta.concurrency-2.0, \
   com.ibm.websphere.appserver.org.eclipse.microprofile.contextpropagation-1.0; ibm.tolerates:="1.1"
 -bundles=\
-  com.ibm.websphere.javaee.concurrent.1.0; location:="dev/api/spec/,lib/"; apiJar=false, \
-  com.ibm.ws.concurrent, \
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.concurrency.2.0; location:="dev/api/spec/,lib/"; mavenCoordinates="jakarta.enterprise.concurrent:jakarta.enterprise.concurrent-api:2.0.0-RC2",\
+  com.ibm.ws.concurrent.jakarta, \
   com.ibm.ws.javaee.platform.defaultresource, \
   com.ibm.ws.resource
 kind=beta
